results.title: Something old, something new
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Smith, Ben Lewin, Karl McPhee and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “The Migrant experience”.
Long-established and recent migrants describe the search for a personal balance between the old traditions and the new ways.

results.title: Something happened
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Healers quacks or mystics”.
Can supernatural forces be summoned at will to assist with human healing? In this episode Nevill Drury introduces us to spiritual healer, Rita McReady; the Assembly of God congregation in Mt. Gravatt, Qld, which conducts miracle services for sufferers each Sunday afternoon; the programs and philosophies practised at the Adventist Sanatorium Hospital in Sydney to mobilise the faith of patients to aid the healing process; the controversial Australian psychic surgeon, Chris Coles and finally the anointing and laying on of hands practised in a Sydney Anglican Church.

results.title: Something for everyone
results.creator_credit: Suzanne Baker, Bob Kingsbury and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Human Face of China”.
The production team is the basic unit of a People’s Commune in China. Following Chian Li-he and his family at home and at work, the film explains how a commune operates. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Something for everyone
results.brief_description: Looks at the problem of youth unemployment and how it affects job seekers. Uses a humorous approach to present the case of a young man who loses his job and the problems he faces when he tries to find another. Cast includes: David Bradley, Lachlin Miles, Dave Taggart, Pina Marino, Rossi Webb, Ingrid Buxton. Music: Milton Trot and Bill Menz.

results.title: Something don't seem right
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Commission, Bill Steller and Robin Hughes
results.brief_description: One of a series of films which looks at the lives of children growing up in different environments. Shows the world of a child living in the inner city area, attending Newtown High School, and the physical and financial constraints on his family.

results.title: Something creative
results.creator_credit: Crafts Council of Australia and Gillian Leahy
results.brief_description: This film looks at the question of creativity in everyday life and examines the role of the professional artist in stimulating and encouraging participation in the arts by the community at large. Focuses on Orange and Blacktown in New South Wales. Cinematography by Erika Addis.

results.title: Something big in micro circuits
results.creator_credit: G. Buckland-Smith, Film Producers Guild, Katrina Rank and Tony Baker
results.brief_description: A detailed look at the vast field of the diminuitive. Animated sequences showing the various etching and photographic processes needed to produce transistors and other miniaturised equipment are described in detail.
